h2. Problem: 

Customer might having a very different color scheme from the default configuration. However, the dialog color(eg. Info) always stays in the default blue and certain customer wish to customize it for unified color scheme in JIRA.

h2. Example:

!Info_Dialog.png|thumbnail!

h2. Suggestion:

Additional configuration in Look and Feel to allow customer further customize their color scheme.
fields.summary: Option to customize AUI Message Dialog color scheme
Option to change the default code macro to a different value than java
Workflow automation via issue event as triggers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45180].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The release date can be set when administrators create a version. But this date will be overwritten with the actual release date when the version is released.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have another field called 'planned release date' so that administrators can keep track of how many days we are early or late for the release.
fields.summary: Planned version release date

fields.description:
This question is about the atlassian JIRA plugin development. When I use event listener to handle JIRA's IssueEvent of comment deleted event, I can catch the comment deleted event with event type "com.atlassian.jira.event.type.EventType.ISSUE_COMMENT_DELETED_ID". But I don't know how can I get the comment id which has been deleted in this event. I've tried the IssueEvent.getComment for this situation, but it returns null. 
BTW, I've tried the change log way to get the comment body of deleted from the change log, but the comment id is still missing and I don't know where to get it.
fields.summary: Cannot get deleted comment id from JIRA's IssueEvent with type ISSUE_COMMENT_DELETED_ID

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45177].
  {panel}

In JIRA 7.X Server and Cloud, the images that come pre-appended by JIRA in the email are of type SVG which unfortunately is not supported by Gmail anymore.

Owing to the fact that a large number of our users use Gmail, can this be fixed.

This has been reported [here|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20815613/svg-images-blocked-by-gmail-proxy].

Also, this affects mails from Service Desk
fields.summary: Email Image attachments do not work in Gmail
Provide the option to disable automatic creation of Components

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45175].
  {panel}

In Jira if you close an issue you can no longer edit it; that makes perfect sense.  However, you also can't add labels to it, which makes it impossible to any kind of analysis of tickets after the fact (eg. to label the bugs found in productions differently from bugs found by QA).  Furthermore, even if the issue isn't closed, you have to go in to the issue, and then open a drop-down just to add a label.

It'd be great if:
A) you could add labels to closed issues (or at least make it an option)
B) add labels more easily on the issue page, without needing the drop-down
C) add labels from the issue list page
fields.summary: Label Improvements: Easier Adding, Allow Adding to Closed Issues, Allow Adding From Issues List
As an Admin, I would like to turn off pop-up tips in JIRA
Ability to edit Label Custom field options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45171].
  {panel}

Currently the time tracking reports page states:
{quote}To generate a Time Tracking Report:

Navigate to the desired project.
Choose Summary (tab) > Reports section > Time Tracking Report. {quote} 

This is no longer correct in JIRA 6.4. To generate a Time Tracking Report, you must:
Navigate to the desired project.
Choose Reports (bar chart tab) > Forecast &management section > Time Tracking Report

The images on this page are also from an older version of JIRA and should be updated.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Reports Documentation Outdated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45166].
  {panel}

h5. Current Behaviour
* New Project Navigation no longer has Version Issue Summary

h5. Feature Request
* Add Version Issue Summary in the New Project Navigation 

7.0.0-OD-02-259

{panel:title=Example Use Case|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1  |bgColor=#FFFFCE  }
By removing this screen from JIRA 7, you've made it difficult to:

a) See how many open tickets are assigned to each developer in a particular version (alternative: filter & count, or use a dashboard widget which needs to be changed every version, both cumbersome)
b) Click to the queue of a particular developer for a particular version (alternative: use issue summary navigator; 4-5 clicks instead of 2)

It seems a completely unnecessary change; why was it removed?
{panel}
fields.summary: Add Version Issue Summary in the New Project Navigation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45163].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Non-required custom field prompted when moving an issue.

As per documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Moving+an+Issue
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/moving-an-issue-185729549.html

{quote}Custom Fields — If you have defined required custom fields for your issue, which do not exist in your target project, you must set values for them. You will only be prompted to change the enter values for required custom fields in the target project, that are missing values. If you wish to change the existing values for other fields on your issue, you can do this after the move is complete.{quote}

*Note* 
Target project is configured to have the custom field but not required.

h3. Suggested Solution
Do not prompt non-required custom field when moving an issue.
fields.summary: Moving an Issue - Non-required custom field prompted when moving an issue

h3. Summary

Deleting an Issue Type somehow fails, resulting in a significant number of NullPointerExceptions to be thrown. This causes the operation of JIRA to fail in multiple areas - JIRA Agile, searching for issues, editing issues, retrieving filters and so on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Deleting the issue type in some sort of specific sequence or event causes this problem to occur. We have not been able to accurately replicate this.

h3. Expected Results

Issue types can be deleted without problems occurring.

h3. Summary
Link to project's Calendar is missing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the project, the Calendar link is missing on new project navigation

h3. Expected Results
!Screen Shot 2015-08-31 at 2.58.06 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2015-08-31 at 2.59.06 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
* Add the gadget JIRA Issues Calendar on a dashboard and filter the required project
* Access the link: {{https://<your instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<key of your project>/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar:issuecalendar-panel}}
fields.summary: Link to project's Calendar is missing

h4. Description

After changing the site URL, the Javascript the Issue Collector still runs being cached with the old site URL.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45042].
  {panel}


h2. Problem Definition
* The *'Configure Fields'* button which exist in the 'Create Issue Pop Up Screen' is not available in the 'Create Issue Screen that is access by URL'. This seems to be a missing functionality at the moment, and are not configurable at the moment.
* Inconsistency of configuration as if through Create Issue Screen Popup, user have configured custom-fields-visibility, when access the create issue screen from a URL link will remove this custom-fields-visibility setup
* To access the URL : https://<your jira URL>/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=1234&issuetype=6 , change PID with appropriate project ID and issue type.
!URL_access_createissue_popup1.png|thumbnail!
!URL_access_createissue_popup.png|thumbnail!
!URL_access_createissue.png|thumbnail!

{quote}
This is needed in order to retain the user preference for the fields on the Create Issue Screen. When we try to create issue using link, Jira looses the custom field preference by the user on the create issue screen and displays all the fields on the screen. Which is annoying for the users who do not want to see all the fileds or all the fields are not useful for users and they have hidden those fileds from screen. It is not necessary to have "Configure Field" button on the screen while creating an issue from link, but Jira must retain the field preference and should only show the fileds which are selected by user through Configure Fields option.
{quote}


h2. Suggested Solution
* To introduce this button in the 'Create Issue Screen that is access by URL' so that consistency can be achieved here.
* To ensure the user preference for the fields on the Create Issue Screen via Screen Popup coexist on the Create Issue Screen via URL
fields.summary: To introduce Configure Fields (Custom field preference) in Create Issue Screen via URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
After installing the Chinese JIRA Translation Pack, and setting the default language to Chinese, tooltips on dates show escape sequences instead of the expected Chinese characters when viewing an issue.

h3. Environment
This was Observed from a Desktop running in English (Australian Locale) with the default language or JIRA set to Chinese

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Chinese Language Pack into JIRA
# Set language to Chinese
# Hover over a Date to show a tooltip when viewing an issue.

h3. Expected Results
The tooltip should show the locale specific date, without the escaped character sequences.

h3. Actual Results
As per the attached screenshot, the tooltip shows escaped sequences of the Chinese characters.

h3. Notes
Translations are provided by customers and external entities, and are not fully supported by Atlassian. For more information please see: [https://translations.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Date Tooltip for Chinese & Russian Dates Show Escape Sequences

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45015].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the [Search Request View|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/jira/search-request-view.html] module returns a 403 Forbidden error when attempting to export more than 1000 issues. 

The issue number export limitation is well known per [CLOUD-6544|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-6544]. However, plug-ins developed to leverage this module return a 403 when a user is trying to export a search with more than 1000 issues with plug-in specific exporting options created with the search request view module. The 403 error may cause the user to assume the plug-in has failed in some way rather than JIRA enforcing a documented limitation.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better if JIRA could send the plug-in the control and, as long as the maxIssues parameter is set for the search request view module, the issue export restriction can be managed.
fields.summary: Improve Error Handling for Search Request View Module

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if I browse to Summary >> Reports >> Group by Report >> I can perform a single level group report. I cannot perform a double level or multi level report.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a JIRA Administrator, I would like to have a Multi Group by Report, as this report would be the ideal to my business. 

In the past, the company *InLabs* provided a third party app named *Multi Group add-on* that provides exactly this feature. But this app is currently archived as we can check through [[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.intenso.jira.plugin.multilevel-groupby-report]]. 


h3. Why this is important
*  Would be the ideal to my business
fields.summary: Ability to perform a Multi Level Group By Report

When user sends email to support address, handler creates new issue, or if user has [DSUP] issue key in mail header it comments issue. This is ok.

Regards, Karen

h3. Problem Definition

After the upgrade to JIRA 7, the project overview page was retired and [the Activity/Statistics page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/browsing-a-project-735937233.html] was introduced.

However, going to this page requires an extra click, as going to the 'Statistics' page requires two, while the overview page was opened immediately.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a project administrator, I'd like to option to make these pages (specialy Statistics) the default pages for a project, open directly when I open the project, so it's similar to how the 'overview' page used to work.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44986].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of the release of JIRA 7, support for Internet Explorer 9 has been [End-of-Lifed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+JIRA#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforJIRA-201502IE9] and is [no longer supported|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html].

Customers who use IE9 are unable to navigate to any part of their JIRA Instance and are redirected back to the JIRA Dashboard

Customers in moderated environments do not have the ability to install an alternative browser (Chrome, Firefox, or Safari) nor the ability to upgrade to a supported version of Internet Explorer (10 or 11)

h3. Suggested Solution
Continued support for IE9 until it is [End-of-Lifed by Microsoft|https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/search?sort=PN&alpha=internet%20explorer] 
 
h3. Workaround 
Install one of the supported web browser
|Microsoft Internet Explorer (Windows)|(/) Versions 10, 11|
|Mozilla Firefox (all platforms)|(/) Latest stable version supported|
|Google Chrome (Windows and Mac)|(/) Latest stable version supported|
|Safari (Mac)|(/) Latest stable version supported|
fields.summary: Support for Internet Explorer 9 in JIRA 7

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Hiding Priority or Resolution,  field causes the error message *"The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down."* to appear when viewing a Project > Issues. 

h3. Environment
{{JIRA v7.0.0-OD-02-247}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Field Configurations
# Hide Priority Field
# Go to a project using the field configuration
# See error message and no issues displayed

h3. Expected Results
Issues should still display

h3. Actual Results
No error is shown in the JIRA log.

Error message that appears
{noformat}
The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
{noformat}

What console displays:
{noformat}
/rest/issueNav/1/issueTable Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 (Bad Request)
batch.js:216 DEPRECATED - Persistent: false has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. 
     at showMsg (https://d1ixbz5qgnvms3.cloudfront.net/instance.atlassian.net/s/c5c95a3c91…_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:2531:1465)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Go to Field Configuration and change Priority or Resolution to *Show*
or
Change the "Order by" option to a visible field
fields.summary: Hiding Priority or Resolution Field Causes Issues To Not Be Displayed When Viewing A Project Board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44969].
  {panel}

h5. Problem definition
Currently JIRA projects can only have a single key associated to it. This is undesirable on certain circumstances.

h5. Suggestion
The idea is to provide aliases for project keys. For instance assume you have the process of having two distinct projects in JIRA for a single project "Foo". One for development and one after the project was released:

Project key: FOO (for released builds)
Project key: FOODEV (for development builds)

Before the project goes live, you only set-up the FOODEV project in JIRA.

It would be great if you could specify a project key alias to FOODEV called FOO which can then be used to look-up FOODEV issues as long as the alias is active.
At the point the project is released you can then remove the alias and add a FOO-project.

The net outcome is that all your employees will always work with the "FOO" project key and it will automatically use the FOODEV-project during the early development phase while later it will automatically use the FOO-project.

No more need to rectify the long project key names for administrators.
fields.summary: Provide project key aliasing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44968].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It's currently not possible to easily change the order in which you would like Stash Servers to be displayed on the "Where do you want to create the branch" dialog screen for Creating Branch in JIRA, especially when you have multiple Stash Servers. The screen only allows a maximum of 3 Stash Applications to be displayed at once, but allows you to scroll to find other hidden Stash Servers. Sometimes even the Primary Stash Server configured is hidden in the bottom of this list.

Problem is that the visibility of Servers that are at the bottom of the list and need to be scrolled to reach is quite low, so this becomes an inconvenience when your mostly used Stash Server is always hidden by default from the screen until you scroll to reach it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement more intuitive arrangement order for Stash Servers in the "Where do you want to create the branch" dialog screen.
* One way to do this is to allow the Stash Servers to appear in the same order set in the Application Navigator.
fields.summary: Arrangement order for Stash Servers in where do you want to create the branch dialog

h3. Problem Definition
As of JIRA 7, support for Internet Explorer 9 has [been end-of-lifed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+JIRA#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforJIRA-201502IE9], however users using IE9 do not receive a notification indicating that their browser is unsupported.
IE8 Users receive a popup message indicating that their browser is not supported however the link provided is invalid: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACloud/Supported+Platforms

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the notification so that IE9 users are notified they are using an Unsupported Browser
Update the notification to link to a valid article: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Supported+Platforms+for+Atlassian+Cloud+Applications
 
h3. Workaround 
none

h3. Summary
Confluence's external macros from JIRA and JIRA Agile aren't working (existing ones) and if new ones are added to Confluence pages they're unable to retrieve JIRA's projects and saved filter, a required step of their configuration, which leads to the following error upon an attempt to save it: {color:red}No project or filter specified.{color}
Macros such as _Issue Statistics_ and _Two Dimensional Filter Statistics_.

h3. *Update*
Confluence is having trouble contacting JIRA whenever an action to fetch JIRA information is required.
In case the user wants to create an issue in JIRA using Confluence quick issue creation, he/she won't be able to browse the Projects available on JIRA due to a problem with the applink.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have JIRA and Confluence Cloud on the same instance
# On a Confluence page add the _Two Dimensional Filter Statistics_ macro
# Search for the JIRA's project or saved filter

A drop-down list of available JIRA project or saved filter should appear according to what was typed

  {panel}

Since Cloud's last release, it's no longer possible to switch the project navigation back to the old default as per: [Configuring Project Navigation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Configuring+Project+Navigation]

*Partial Workaround*

If your interested in the statistics in the 'overview' page, you can use the 'issue statistics gadget' to view them. This won't require a filter and will look very similar to the old view and won't require a filter to be created.

To do that:
# Create a dashboard to show the statistics
# Add the [Issue Statistics gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Issue+Statistics+Gadget] to it (one for each project and statistics)
# Select the project from which you want to see these statistics
# Select in 'Statistic Type' the field you want to see (for example, statistics that were shown in the 'overview' page include: 'priority', 'assignee', 'status' and 'component')

{panel:title=Update as of 17 September July 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,
We shipped some improvements in how attachments can be added this week and here's the new pieces we added:
* Drag and drop functionality: Grab files from anywhere and drop them to an issue.
* Copy and paste: You can now paste files directly to an issue too.

As part of this, we decided to remove the Attach Screenshot option to simplify the menu. But the functionality remains unchanged, i.e. you can still take screenshots with the same keyboard and then just paste on to the issue. You will get the same dialog where you can rename the screenshot.
Thanks for letting us know your thoughts as always!
Cheers,
Lingbo
{panel}

Hi.

I wanted to paste a link to the last comment in JRA-19537 into an email. I right clicked on the icon in the top right of the comment and copied the link. Then I pasted this link into my email:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19537?focusedCommentId=726539&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-726539

This URL seems unnecessarily long and ugly to me. Would it be possible to make the copied link shorter? Something like one of the following?

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19537?focusedCommentId=726539
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19537?commentId=726539
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19537#comment-726539

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44895].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Users who doesn't have *JIRA Users* _Global Permission_ cannot edit their _Filters_ permission, since he has to re-login but the credentials aren't accept.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with *JIRA Administrators* permission but without *JIRA Users* permission
# Login with that user
# Create a _Filter_
# Try editing the filter's permission

h3. Expected Results
User should see filter edition page so he can update the permissions

h3. Actual Results
JIRA is redirected to login page
!bug.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Redirect to login page when attempting to change permissions on Filter
Improve user administration by changing the group filter dropdown for a text box
JIRA "Modifying Bulk Issues" Documentation 404 / Not Found
